availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George William Jameson (Pendleton County, Ky, constable, farmer, and deputy court clerk)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, constable, farmer, and deputy court clerk. Bath County, Kentucky, native. Son of George Jameson and Mary Jameson. Married to Amanda Watson Jameson in Scott County, Kentucky, on December 16, 1850. Father of Ann P. Jameson, John W. Jameson, William B. Jameson, George B. Jameson, Sarah M. Jameson, and James R. Jameson. Constable in Pendleton County in 1860. Deputy clerk of the Pendleton Circuit Court in 1861. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 436.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 410B-411A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Scott County Marriages, 1803-1883, Film #000183225, p. 322 of 331 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Pendleton County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 124.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994043, Johnson, Kenton, and Knott County Deaths, p. 580 of 646 of microfilm.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1965), KDLA, Film #7015459: Covington, Certificates 1-969 (1907), File #2944, p. 219 of 1076 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, “George William Jameson (1827-1907)," Memorial # 201658808, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/201658808/george-william-jameson (accessed March 30, 2021).
KYR-0001-020-1563.
